short_summary: Phase 2 electrical upgrades at Madeira Park Small Craft Harbour
description: Supply and install electrical equipment to upgrade the electrical infrastructure according to the National Building Code and the Canadian Construction Safety Code. The contract includes the removal of existing equipment and the installation of new electrical equipment. The scope of work also includes the connection of the electrical system to the power grid. The tender will be posted on the Government Electronic Tendering System (GETS).
full_summary:
### Tender Announcement

#### Phase 2 F1571-220960 : Madeira Park Small Craft Harbour - Electrical Upgrades

**Reference Number:** WS4164271490-Doc4264047233
**Tender Closing Date:** 8 November 2023 at 14:00
**Contracting Agency:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
**End User:** Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO)

#### About the Tender

This solicitation concerns the electrical upgrades at the Madeira Park Small Craft Harbour, located in Madeira Park, British Columbia. The contractor will be responsible for supplying all necessary equipment, labour, and materials to complete the work.

The scope of the project includes the removal of existing electrical infrastructure, such as panels, cabinets, and cabling, and the installation of new equipment, following an electrical construction sequence. The contractor must adhere to provincial, local, and municipal regulations, as well as the National Building Code and the Canadian Construction Safety Code.

The contract will be awarded through a two-phase competitive process, with both phases posted on the Government Electronic Tendering System (GETS).

**Notice Details**

* **Publication Date:** 19 October 2023
* **Procurement Category:** CNST - Construction Services
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective tendering
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity:** None
* **Regions of Delivery:** British Columbia

**Contractor Information**

If you are interested in responding to this tender, please contact the following:

* **Name:** Rodnie Allison
* **Email:** [rodnie.allison@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:rodnie.allison@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Phone:** 
* **Fax:** 
* **Address:**
